text: Yeah getting sexually harassed does offend me and I’m aloud to be offended.
@therealdokstrange lmao feminist deleted her comment. You destroyed her with logic.

@itztheegay majority of us real men already adhere to a high standard...working long hours....protecting our wife and daughters, raising our sons to be great men....staying involved with everything our children do..and keeping God in our lives... The ad, to us real masculine men paints us in the same picture as these A Hole men... The ad should have been soly directed towards them.. And to suggest that Masculine men cannot be a little sensitive is asinine on your part. If you cant understand how us real men feel then I cant help you.

@itztheegay lame men are rapist..real masculine men are not rapist...I come from a long line of family men who protect women as well as their family..all of friends are real stand up men and I raise my boys as such...dont put all of us good men in the same boat as the A holes.. And FYI if it wasnt for us masculine good men you nor I would not have been born...last time I checked woman cant A sexually reproduce and woman who think they are men could not make a baby with out being a woman and accepting sperm into their bodies... #factz #masculinity #realmen #stopmixinguswiththelames

@lilnoosh yes masculinity is only reserved for men...I dont care what liberal bull crap you are on... I dont care about these mental cases of women trying to be men and men trying to be woman...no matter what magic pill or surgery you the two sexes could never swap sides..so stop trying and like I said before there is no such thing as toxic masculinity there are only ass hole men...and Im tired of people like you trying to compare gender issues to racial discrimination...how dare you... Please stay the hell off of my page if you do not agree with me...you are the only troll on here..so either you dont have a man or if you have one he is obviously not tending to your needs...

@lilnoosh those other scenes have nothing to do with the overall message... Just admit that the commercial is jacked up...but then again you are a woman and will never understand a mans feelings of how we view masculinity...just how we would never fully understand a womans feminility...even if you had a man in your life to explain this to you ...you will still never fully understand.. If I were you I would stick to being a woman and letting us guys speak amongst each other about this issue.

@lilnoosh there was no bullying going on it was 2 kids wrestling....they didnt even have to show men BBQ...why wait to the end to show men standing up....just show that from the get go.....all this other bull about showing us men drinking beer...BBQ....wrestling...gawking at a female...paints all of those actions as so called "TOXIC".

@lilnoosh its obvious that after that report came out on the news that said men have too much testosterone this commercial comes ourbif you cant see that then I dont know what to tell you...but no there is nothing masculine about sexually assaulting  woman.... Every masculine man wants to love and protect woman...there is no complexity about it... Us men are rough...and we sometimes get rowdy...but we are protectors....the only gripe we have is this commercial that lumps us in the same boat as A hole men...point blank period... The commercial should have just shown us masculine men standing up for a woman being verbally and or physically attacked because guess what??? Thats what real masculine men do...or standing up against bully's ...again thats what real men do... If you cant understand this I dont know what to tell you.

@babycatincarolina I watched the whole commercial you should watch it for yourself..you will see what Im talking about...Like I said that commercial could have been good if they were not trying so hard to follow the medias narrative.
@therealdokstrange THEY DID. How much of it did you watch?

@babycatincarolina maybe they could have showed us good masculine men stepping up for a woman who was physically or orally disrespected. But to lump us good masculine men in with these A holes was wrong...and conveniently when that ad came out the so called top psychological institute claims there is too much Masculinity in males...then add to the fact the media is pushing this transgender bull crap down our throats further shows us real men that real masculinity is being attacked.

@babycatincarolina again it isnt about improvement it was about lumping all of us good men in with the A holes... Somethings in that ad was irrelevant to the message...like the BBQ scene and drinking beer...or the boys wrestling.... And even the guys looking at a pretty woman was demonized.... The right commercial would have been to show the A holes
Oh my God, if you get offended by an ad telling people that they can improve for the better (who couldn't- nobody's perfect), then what is wrong with yall?

@lilnoosh if want to believe everything media tells you than fine...but there is no such thing as Toxic Masculinity is either there are good masculine men like myself...or there are lame men who run around acting like A holes... Dont put those A holes in the same name category as us real men who are ruff but at the same time respect, want, love and protect women. These psychologists are just trying to come up with new definitions to stay relevant...while trying to demasculate men.
Yes

@queen_astro there is no such thing as Toxic Masculinity..but there is a such thing as A hole men which most of us arent...the commercial stereotyped all men...from the scenes of the BBQ...to boys wrestling...to showing us as all men as extremely rugged.. Me an most men would not have been upset at this commercial if they just had showed the A hole men..or maybe showing us men who stand up for a woman being harassed would have been fine...but to add in everything that most of us men love and lump it together with the men that do the worst was just wrong...thats why us real men are upset..
@lilnoosh there is no such thing as Toxic Masculinity but there is a such thing as a man being a Dick...which most men aren't..

what a snowflake 😂

@lilnoosh I understand what you are saying, but I myself do not believe in systematic oppression. Nobody is held back from moving up. It's the lower class who are actually entitled to even more assistance and opportunity than the upper class. with food, child care, schooling, etc. Living on both sides, the lower end and middle class... where I'm at now....there is no help, no assistance, no funding anymore now that we make enough to get along fine. But There are so many options so that people do not have to be oppressed or remain oppressed. People choose to stay where they are, maybe they are afraid, maybe they are comfortable, maybe they are lazy, or maybe they just dont know their options. But If a Person who really wants to get out of their oppression they absolutely can. Look at Dr. Ben Carson..what an incredible struggle and journey. Actually many of the very wealthy, successful people today all started from nothing.  It's all about attitude in my opinion, and nothing more.

@lilnoosh also I hate to say it because I dont hold grudges, but I grew up abused as well. And so this is why I have no pity for feminists, women who think because they were mistreated, or poor, etc...we deserve everything. And anything bad or unfair that happens is because of men. It was the feminists who almost talked me I to aborting my first baby, so close. They lied to me and said its my right, it's not a human life. I cant thank God enough for the ProLife activits.  Yea I was a teen, yea a minority, yea dirt poor, unmarried, not in any position to raise ababy. But I chose to be responsible for my actions, I chose to respect human life. And instead of blaming abuse, and poverty and men, etc....I understood everything life is what I want it to be. And because I was a woman and very hard off, I had some government assistance to help me through and loans to get through school. So there is no woman out there who can convince me that its mens faults, or that women do not have equal rights. I've proven to women that it all depends on yourself, so stop blaming others.

@krystlelynn_88 I definitely teach them well...I guess because of the timing...the way the media pushed that report about how masculinity is toxic didnt really strike a good cord with us good men. Epsecially when they spoke about figuring out how to lower testosterone in growing young men and mix that with the change in this country where almost half is moving away from the nuclear family is really frustrating, when men like me value a mother and a father living life together to raise children as God intended.

@lilnoosh I know for a fact it didnt all come from respect. I grew up very hard off, at one point my mom, dad and my siblings and I lived in a tiny camper, studio apartments, all around. My dad was an immigrant from Mexico who earned his citizenship as a young adult, and then had kids at a very young age, with nothing he owned, no money.  I was never privileged. Not to mention I'm one of those teen pregnancy statistics, my first child was unplanned, I was young, poor, moved into a 13ft camper with my husband (who was a kid himself at the time). that's where we started.  Nothing was ever given to me, but the lesson of love and respect. And from learning to respect myself, I took care of myself, and from respecting my husband as a man....by not feeling like the world owes me something for being a woman, for being hispanic, for being poor, by not stomping my feet and joining the feminist pity league, I came up from a very low point. Nobody paid for nursing school for me, I had 2 kids as I got through it, we almost lost our home, sold our crib just to get groceries to survive. I mean talk about under priveledged. But if I had a bad attitude and felt it's all because of men, I wouldn't have made it this far. I came this far by loving, respecting and working hard at my life.  All this to say, i may seem like life has been easy, multi business owner, RN, wife, mother...sounds like a great life. and it is. But I worked hard to get here, and wouldn't have made it this far if I didnt respect myself, my parents, my husband, God.

@therealdokstrange see when you say sissy I think of a boy who cries and has feelings. And has to act like he likes sports, cars, and fishing when in reality he may not.  Teaching your son to be respectful and take care of women 👌 yes 🙌 absolutely teach that boy how to change a tire (too many boys don’t know how 😂 and my son will). The commercial is made to make the few bad man stand out to the others. Like your sons for example. If they seen a woman being harassed you would tech them to stand up for that woman. If they seen a boy being picked on in school, you’d teach your sons to be the good guy in the commercial and maybe help stop it or check on the person being bullied because that’s the right thing to do. It’s not all men. In the commercial men stop the toxic masculinity. Not to be confused with masculinity which many feminists do indeed like. I like a man who might have a Beard, make me feel safe and protected can work on a car, and kill me a deer... because I don’t 😂 I’ll do it but I’d rather him do it and I’ll make him venison for dinner as a thank you. I wear all feminists aren’t femi nazis man haters

@krystlelynn_88 when I mean sissy I meant a Man who doesnt stand for anything that is right. I like my father raise my boys to be respectful and protect the woman in their lives..wether that woman is a friend, associate, or family. My boys are rugged in some aspects but are clean. I raise men who are not afraid to get dirty( Yard work, Hunting, House work, or any work that is beneficial to his family) I teach my boys to not be ashamed to be a Mans Man... I did not like the commercial because it bunched all of us men up with the A Holes. I and many other good men felt that the  advert portraid all men actions as harmful to society when it is not. Yes us men oogle at woman we are supposed to(its nature), yes us boys and men wrestle( not to be confused with bullying) yes us boys get dirty( but we also know how to clean up).
I didn’t know raising mind humans  meant raising “sissy’s” I guess were not allowed to be kind 🙄🙄🙄
@jaymeplog I teach all of sons and daughters to always have respect for themselves and others. Learn, work hard, always put GOD first.

@emako_3lue the last thing I'll say is that you feminist have it all wrong. Very hypocritical. You support this Gillette commercial suggesting that men need to teach little boys to be respectful, in the way they act and live their lives..... yet at the same time you are telling me not to teach my daughters to be respectful in the way they act and live???... lmao. It makes no sense! And that's the problem with feminists. "Men, you need to be more respectful! Women, do whatever the hell you want and don't worry about respect!" I rest my case. Have a nice day.

@emako_3lue  a sad little housewife? Like myself? Happily married for 10 years, I take cruises, plane trips, I shop where I want, I drive the Cadillac Escalade that I want, I work as a registered nurse, thinking about going back to be a nurse practitioner, run multiple businesses with my husband, ..,.. I mean we've built a freaking Empire, and this all came out of mutual respect. I don't bow down to him, and he doesn't bow down to me. That's the problem right there, is that women think it's a power struggle, and it's a matter of bowing down. It doesn't need to be that way, it shouldn't be that way ever. Treat each other with respect, and the rest will work itself out. I don't resent my mother for raising me to be respectful, I'm glad she did. Life has been that much greater for me because of respect. I feel sorry for the women who are out there trying really hard to prove themselves, struggling, filled with hate, spending their days on a power struggle, for nothing. They are proving nothing, and not winning any battles. Once they learn to be respectful, then they will see victory

@emako_3lue  exactly, they don't have to be portrayed like that. So why is Gillette portraying them in that light? I'm just saying, if the roles were reversed in this commercial targeted women and how they need to act more respectful and hold each other accountable. "Is this the best women can be?" You know every single feminist would be on fire right now and burning down the Gillette Factory. It was wrong of them to Target men. The problem with bullying and sexual assault is not due to men only, it involves women as well. And so if they are not going to address the true problem, then they need to just stick to selling razors

@emako_3lue that's the way I was raised. I was I was taught to be respectful to men, and to myself. With the way I act, the clothes I wear, the way live my life, I was always taught to be respectful. So I've always respected man. And because of the mentality was raised with, I've been married to an amazing man for 10 years now, with two beautiful daughters from him. He's treated me wonderful my whole life, has never harmed to me emotionally or physically, and would lay down his life for me. Same with my dad, my brother, brother in law's, father-in-law. Every man in my life. So I'm not sure how you think that respect leads to destruction? It's actually the opposite. The person who has disrespect for anybody else, that will lead to hate, more disrespect, and destruction. You really need to rethink your plan

@emako_3lue and I dont even know why you are in this conversation when this post wasnt for you...how are you going to comment on a post about masculinity when you are walking around wearing panties with your dick tucked trying to convince yourself you are a woman...please get off my post...BY FELICIA!

@emako_3lue  that's not what I'm talking about though. I'm talking about the commercial, suggesting that boys will be boys. Meaning it's just natural for a boy to want to be a bully, and to want to assault women. How cruel is that accusation?  And not to mention women are way worse at bullying than men are. It's just very wrong for Gillette to call out man, and claim they are the problem. Women are just as responsible for this problem, the reason women are seen as sex symbols, is because everywhere you look that's all women are doing. Instagram, snapchat, Facebook ,Pornography, stripping, these teenybopper music stars like Ariana Grande portraying herself as a sex idol.... I mean can you blame a man for viewing women that way? We make it look like that's what we want.  But that being said, there are also many men who are not attracted to that stuff whatsoever. My husband and my dad for example, they are disgusted by the way women act and dress, it's a complete turn-off and loss of respect for them. And that's why the commercial ad is very misleading, and a lie. Boys will be boys, also means that they will be respectful, they will protect women, they will love women, and they will spend their lives acting kind towards women....no Gillette ad needed. Feminists make this world such a hateful place, they want war. But women like myself, we dont. We just want to have mutual respect with men, we want to build them up, we know they are capable of great things and we want them to appreciate women, not be forced to.

And if it werent for strong masculine men you nor I would have been born.  When your father saw your mother..for the first time .he didnt look at her and say "she has a nice personality" no he thought in his mind " Damn she looks good" then he got to know her and the relationship grew from there... Now there is a difference between being a Masculine man and being a Dick...I teach my sons to respect and protect women. My sons are into what Im into ( Gun Ranges, Fishing, Working on the family car, Football, Wrestling). And For your information: 95% of us men are not Dicks.
@emako_3lue so your point is because you act like a girl doesnt make you less of a man???? Umm ok what ever you gotta tell yourself...

@therealdokstrange  @emako_3lue  absolutely. And I feel the problem nowadays is women have too many rights and think they are higher and above men, and that we should have all the power to do whatever we want, say what we want, wear what we want, act how we want and men just have to shut up and be muzzled. What happened to the days when women respected men? And the man was the leader? What happened to modest, humble women? If women acted more like ladies, and showed more respect to men...maybe they would act and feel differently towards women. Im a mom of 2 daughters and I hope to raise them with respect for themselves, and for men. It should be equal, not women treading on men every chance they get.
@emako_3lue she just respects a real man Like most woman do.
